title: Gavkhuni Marsh Land
content: The marshland or swamp of Gavkhuni (Gavkhani) is located at the center of Iran near Esfahan city. This Marsh is a stooping place for a long journey the Zayandé Rood river has embarked upon from the Bakhtlary Zardkooh heights. Gavkhuni is included in the list of Iran’s international marshlands (basins) and enjoys a high biological and natural significance. The migratory and local birds live in this Marsh and. The surface of Gavkhuni marsh is about 5OOkm2. The Black Mountain with the altitude of 1700m is a trachyte-andesite, trachyte-dacitic mass which has created a vast landscape of Gavkhuni by the side of Marsh for the tourists to enjoy. Gavkhuni Marsh is the result of a broad yet not deep subsidence (Shahrabi,1994). The flood and alluvial plains and little fells have embraced this Marsh. The Aeolian dunes and salt-gypsum deposits can also be seen in its surroundings. So many sedimentary structures can be seen throughout the Marsh, some of which are so scenic.
